title: Hands Off! fury in pics: America rises up against Donald Trump's policies
story_summary: Tens of thousands protested across the U.S. against Donald Trump's policies, organized under the "Hands Off!" banner. Rallies in all 50 states voiced anger over government cuts, immigration stances, and LGBTQ+ rights rollbacks. Criticism targeted Elon Musk's role in government efficiency initiatives. Protesters included civil rights advocates, unions, and former Republicans. The White House defended Trump's policies, while Trump spent the day golfing.

title: Mohammed Siraj breaks silence on Champions Trophy snub, Gujarat Titans pacer says ‘I could not digest at the start…’
story_summary: Mohammed Siraj addressed his exclusion from the ICC Champions Trophy squad, admitting initial difficulty in accepting it. Despite being a consistent ODI bowler for India, selectors felt his effectiveness diminished without the new ball. Siraj refocused on his mindset and fitness, playing Ranji Trophy and preparing for the IPL. He's currently performing well in IPL 2025, aiming to prove selectors wrong. Gujarat Titans, his team, moved to second place in the IPL standings.

title: Indian Pharma, and two other sectors to perform ‘better’ than global peers amid Trump tariffs, says Geojit’ Vinod Nair
story_summary: Geojit's Vinod Nair suggests Indian pharma, semiconductors, and energy sectors will outperform due to Trump's reciprocal tariffs. India's ongoing trade negotiations with the U.S. may mitigate adverse effects. Domestic-oriented industries like agriculture and finance are relatively safe from direct tariff impacts. Indian markets may face near-term weakness but are expected to outperform other major economies. The IT sector, with high U.S. exposure, is under pressure. A U.S. recession probability has risen to 40%.

title: Bernie Sanders warns of ‘unprecedented danger’ to US democracy, adds ‘you can thank Elon Musk and Trump for that’
story_summary: Bernie Sanders warned of an "unprecedented danger" to U.S. democracy, citing growing inequality and corporate influence. He criticized Elon Musk and Donald Trump for contributing to the crisis, accusing them of enabling a government "run by the billionaire class." Sanders expressed concern over the erosion of democratic norms and the power of wealthy elites. He also criticized Democratic leadership for not fighting hard enough for working-class Americans, accusing them of taking contributions from the wealthy.

title: Kieron Pollard lifts Jasprit Bumrah in excitement after MI pacer makes IPL return, fans react ‘handle with care’
story_summary: Jasprit Bumrah returned to Mumbai Indians after injury, greeted by Kieron Pollard who lifted him in excitement. Fans humorously cautioned Pollard to handle Bumrah carefully to avoid re-injury. Bumrah participated in net sessions, showing no discomfort, raising hopes for his performance against RCB. He has played for MI his entire IPL career, with 165 wickets in 133 matches. He missed the 2023 season due to a back injury but was MI's leading wicket-taker in the prior season.

title: ‘Shame on you’: Indian-American Microsoft engineer Vaniya Agarwal confronts Gates, Nadella over AI use by Israel in Gaza
story_summary: Microsoft's 50th-anniversary event was disrupted by Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American engineer, protesting the company's involvement in Israeli military operations. Agrawal confronted Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer, and Satya Nadella, accusing Microsoft of enabling genocide in Gaza through its $133 million cloud and AI contract with Israel's Ministry of Defense. She resigned, calling Microsoft a "digital weapons manufacturer" and urging colleagues to challenge the company's policies. The company has not commented on the resignations or accusations.

title: Second Unvaccinated Child With Measles Case Dies in Texas
story_summary: An unvaccinated school-aged child in Texas died from measles complications amidst a growing outbreak. The child had no known underlying health conditions. This is the second measles-related death in Texas this year.  There have been 607 measles cases reported across 21 states, with 97% involving unvaccinated individuals. The measles vaccine (MMR) is highly effective. Texas has reported 481 cases, the most in the US.  The HHS Secretary has openly questioned the safety of vaccines.

title: Apple Keeps TikTok on Its Store After Assurances from AG Bondi
story_summary: Apple is keeping TikTok on its US App Store after receiving assurances from Attorney General Pam Bondi, extending a pause on a potential ban.  Bondi referenced a Trump executive order for the extension. TikTok remains available on Google Play as well.  US officials were close to securing a deal for a US version of TikTok, but it was nixed after Trump imposed tariffs on trading partners. Concerns about TikTok's Chinese ownership and potential data sharing with the Chinese government led to the original ban consideration.

title: Did Jaya Bachchan refuse clicking pic with a woman at Manoj Kumar's prayer meet? Internet backs her for first time
story_summary: Jaya Bachchan attended Manoj Kumar's prayer meet in Mumbai. A video surfaced showing Jaya seemingly displeased when a woman approached her for a photo.  Jaya pulled her hand away and appeared to decline the photo.  Reddit users largely supported Jaya, criticizing the woman for requesting a photo at a prayer meet.  Some on X criticized Jaya's behavior, while others defended her.  Aamir Khan, Farhan Akhtar, and other celebrities also attended the prayer meet.

title: Trump Tariff Turmoil: White House officials claims 'over 50 nations' want to start trade talks as market fear looms
story_summary: White House officials claim over 50 nations want trade talks after Trump's tariffs, which triggered a $6 trillion U.S. stock market loss. Officials portray tariffs as strategic repositioning and downplay economic fallout.  Treasury Secretary Bessent says Trump has "maximum leverage." Taiwan offered zero tariffs as a basis for talks.  Critics blame tariffs for market drop, fearing inflation and slowed growth.  JPMorgan estimates tariffs will reduce GDP by 0.3%.  Trump shared a video suggesting tariffs aim to force lower interest rates.

title: Wall Street week ahead: Spotlight on Trump tariffs fallout, CPI inflation, Fed minutes
story_summary: Wall Street anticipates a week dominated by the fallout from Trump's tariffs, with investors fearing slowed growth and increased inflation. Key economic data releases include CPI, PPI, and Federal Reserve minutes. The week also marks the start of Q1 earnings season, with major US banks reporting. Last week, US stock markets plummeted after China retaliated with tariffs. Investors will closely watch for signs of economic impact and Fed's response.

title: Kavya Maran's animated reactions go viral after Sunrisers Hyderabad batters bite dust against Gujarat Titans; watch
story_summary: Kavya Maran's reactions went viral as Sunrisers Hyderabad struggled against Gujarat Titans.  Maran, a regular at SRH home games, showed displeasure as key batters failed.  SRH's top order, including Head and Sharma, couldn't replicate their previous strong performance. Maran signaled for caution from the stands but SRH lost wickets regularly.  Cameras captured her worried expressions. Mohammed Siraj took 4 wickets. Gujarat Titans won the match.

title: Saudi Arabia bans visas for 14 countries including India; full list
story_summary: Saudi Arabia has suspended certain visas for 14 countries, including India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh, to control overcrowding during the Hajj pilgrimage. Umrah, business, and family visit visas are suspended until mid-June. The ban aims to prevent unauthorized Hajj participation using other visa types.  Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman ordered stricter visa enforcement.  Visit visas and Umrah visas will be issued until April 13. The decision follows the 2024 Hajj tragedy with over 1,000 deaths.

title: Russian spy sensors found stalking UK's nuclear submarine routes: Report
story_summary: Russian surveillance sensors have been discovered tracking UK's nuclear submarines. The sensors, found in UK waterways, are suspected of monitoring and potentially sabotaging military infrastructure. This is considered a national security threat. Officials suspect the Kremlin is behind the operation.  There is rising concern of “greyzone” warfare.  Over the past 15 months, internet cables in the Baltic Sea have been damaged, believed to be caused by Russian ships.  The UK is responding with a new programme called Atlantic Bastion to patrol UK waters.

title: Grim outlook: How are Wall Street biggies reacting to Trump's Tariffs?
story_summary: A Forbes report surveyed Wall Street's top 50 figures regarding Trump's economic strategies, particularly tariffs. 72% of previous Trump supporters now deem his economic plan ineffective. Overall, 66% oppose his policies, with 54% citing poor execution. Trump's tariff policy received a low rating of 1.86 out of 5. Economists foresee negative impacts, with Morningstar labeling it a "self-inflicted economic catastrophe". Concerns rise over a potential trade war and economic slowdown.
